meanings.definition: The act or state of obtruding.
meanings.sent1: The obtrusions of his opinions in the meeting were unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: The obtrusions of the tree branches into the path made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent3: The obtrusions of the loudspeaker's voice during the quiet play made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her constant obtrusions into my personal space felt like a physical barrier.
meanings.sent5: The obtrusions of the bright colors in the painting caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Something that obtrudes or is obtruded.
meanings.sent1: I removed the obtrusions from the road to clear the way for traffic.
meanings.sent2: The obtrusions on the wall were actually small sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The obtrusions of the unexpected guest at the party added to the excitement.
meanings.sent4: The obtrusions of the sharp rocks on the beach made walking barefoot challenging.
meanings.sent5: The obtrusions of the new building in the old neighborhood changed the skyline.
